metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2337 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Type confusion exists in _cancel_eval Ruby's TclTkIp class method. Attacker passing different type of object than String as "retval" argument can cause arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2337` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04
ruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04
ruby2.3-tcltk - 2.3.1-2~16.04
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ruby2.3 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-2~16.04').
